You are going to remember, in 2005, should your president of Harvard when i bought it, Lawrence Summers, created such an uproar with disparaging comments about women's aptitude for science and math. Research indicates that American girls around between 9 and 17 consistently had fewer experiences in a very science realm than boys, and customarily expressed negative perceptions and attitudes toward science and math classes.
